Posts.Content: Hi puzzler, how long did your cording take to resolve?  Wendy xx
Posts.Title: On the outside looking in

Posts.Content: Omg mistymoley, sorry but had a little chuckle at that one  Xx
Posts.Title: On the outside looking in

Posts.Content: Lisa Mc thankyou, it's a relief to know that my feelings are normal, i find out on wednsesday just how many nodes are involved, hopefully just the 2, i can but hope xx Mistymoley it is so painful at times it's unreal, i'm hoping my own nurse listens, she's been really good so far, i'm gonna give the door frame a go, not got anything to lose and i've still got some codiene if all else fails Thankyou ladies  Wendy xx
Posts.Title: On the outside looking in

Posts.Content: Thankyou for your reply Snowys Mum I rang the bc nurse on Thursday about the cording, my nurse is on holiday and i've been told to persevere with the exercises as they rarely refer to phsysio, will speak to my own nurse about it on wednesday, bad enough having 2 surgeries in 4 weeks without this restricting my movement, i'm hoping that i get the all clear to be referred on to oncology as well, feels like a lifetime ago since my diagnosis (25th May) nearly time to face the next battle Much love
Posts.Title: On the outside looking in

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I'm new to this group although i've been following for a few weeks trying to make sense of things, (never gonna happen), i'm 39 years old and been diagnosed with idc grade 3 2/2 lymph nodes involved HER2 ER PR positive, i've had a wle, slnb followed by a full alnc all in the space of 4 weeks, 1.5 weeks post op and i've also developed cording, painful to say the least but whilst all this is going on and it's all pretty real i feel like it's not happening to me, like i've become detached from the whole situation, i'm not used to spending so much time in my own company, i usually work full time but been on sick since my 1st op, i get my results next wednesday, dont know what to expect anymore, dont know how far this disease has spread, the only thing i do know is my treatment plan which i've known about since my diagnosis, guess i'm just wanting a bit of reassurance that my feelings towards this is normal, i feel like i've accepted it but then i feel like it isnt happening to me, sorry for the long ass rambling
Posts.Title: On the outside looking in

Posts.Content: Hi dozyfiend I'm doing the exercises religiously, altho i've been waiting for the pop the nurse told me to expect, didn't realise it could disappear on it's own so thank you for that advice Despite the pain i'm keeping positive, one step at a time  Much love  Wendy xx
Posts.Title: On the outside looking in

Posts.Content: Hi redkite I suffered badly with nausea after my 2nd Ec chemo, i found eating little and often, flavouring water with a little fruit juice helped, I can't stand ginger but my tastebuds were shot so i gave it a try and that also helped. Make sure you ring your chemo helpline and get your meds changed, i've been prescribed Emend and it's worked a treat, had my 3rd on wednesday and have felt a lot better this time, please don't suffer, the nurses will do all they can to help you  Wendy xx
Posts.Title: Struggling to drink recommended fluids after chemotherapy!

Posts.Content: I think i may have it sorted for now, i rang the pharmacy when i calmed down a bit and explained what has happened and that i'll be in again thursday with another prescription so she's going to order the 20mg today so it's already in stock for me, just got a bit worked up as i've still 8 sessions of RT to go and i can be out for 3 hours some days with travelling and waiting about and tomorrow will be longer as i have my 3 weekly Herceptin at a different hospital
Posts.Title: Pharmacy, Gp and Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: After persuading my gp surgery to specify Teva on my prescription i've been to pick my 1st repeat prescription up from the pharmacy (mine is sent electronically) checked my tablets to find they had given me a different brand, cue a very stern talking to from me,  they've had the script 4 days so no excuse, have to wait another day now as they have to be ordered in, so on top of 2 hospital appointments tomorrow at different hospitals i now have to again go out of my way to the chemist and then to top it all off i've checked my repeat slip to find my gp's have prescribed the wrong dose, 10mg instead of 20mg so now i'm at boiling point, as i can't pick a new prescription up from them until thursday!! I could bloody well scream
Posts.Title: Pharmacy, Gp and Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hi justlittleme I've already started Tamoxifen and so far doing ok but my ocologist has also asked me about zoladex and her reasoning about the injections were if you have too many effects from the lack of eostrogen the injections are reversible, ovary removal isn't, i'm back on the 15th feb to discuss a start date then if all goes well i'll consider a oopherectomy later, i personally don't want to have any more surgery just yet, still trying to recover from the 3 i had last year
Posts.Title: Injection or removal of ovaries?

Posts.Content: Hi ladies Been to see oncologist today and walked out with extra goodies to see me through my 2nd tax, B6 tablets for the finger pain, steroid cream for the foot pain, 4 days of extra steroid tablets and some antibiotics as i have a picc line infection, gonna be rattling soon lol
Posts.Title: 2nd T this week. How is everyone else doing ?

Posts.Content: Hi Tray41 I'm due my 2nd T next week, found it much harder going than the EC i had for my 1st 3, no bone pain as i took loratadine but i have ached, my fingertips really hurt and the soles of my feet are quite sore, will bring this up with my oncologist on wednesday, also developed a really sore itchy rash on my neck, finally clearing after 6 days of fucidin cream. Nails have been ok so far, plenty of hand cream and nail protector. Like you i'm counting down the days, I need some kind of normality back
Posts.Title: 2nd T this week. How is everyone else doing ?
